Fields.DialogueText: Well, I see someone hasn't wasted any time... you didn't even let the ink dry on my gambling reinstatement order.
It took you long enough to lift it.
I wanted to use it as a reward for extended good behavior. That said, that's an unusual set of dice you've got, Pola.
Custom made. I like to pass them to idiots who want this so-called little girl to hand them over.
And how much do they weigh, again?
Heh, heh...

Fields.MenuText: I'll be sure to let the infirmary know about the imminent increase in sprained wrists and elbows.
I thought the boxing ring was enough violence for you.
Hand them over, Pola. I'll need to know what the threshold is when you enforce the "no weaklings allowed" policy.

Fields.DialogueText: And broken fingers.
So did I, in the same way I am satisfied after a meal.
Give the crew some credit. It's amazing how quickly they catch on.
Those dice wouldn't be made from parts of this ship, would they?
They... might be from some of my scrap metal, yes.
And how much control do you have over them? As if I couldn't guess...
...Un po.
I think that tells me all I need to know. If you ever invite me to play craps, don't complain when I bring the dice.
@BATTLE
I'm sensing Morganas, Capitano. Let's fight for that "if," shall we?
Last call! Place your bets!
Two on Nowak!
Two on Pola sending him flying a meter!
Good luck with that...five on Pola, no range!
I know I reinstated gambling, but I'm not sure I approve of it being on boxing matches.
But Captain, this isn't on boxing. It's for arm wrestling.

Fields.MenuText: Then put me down for ten on Pola sending him all the way to the infirmary.
How much for the captain showing up and sending every last one of you to extra duty?
Games of chance are one thing, but this is just begging for someone to throw a match. No more, understood?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain!
... Even odds?
Hey, Pola! You won the pool on the Captain's response! Word for word!
Are you here to spoil my fun?
No, actually. I received a tour request from a member of the Admiralty.
You accepted, right?
Well, yes.
*ALARM*
And Cariddi to fight, too. I'll make this quick, then. ...Nowak!
Don't maim him.
@BATTLE
... Happy to be of service.
Action stations, crew. Three cheers for war!
@BATTLE
I must say, Pola, I am surprised. I didn't expect your level of enthusiasm for the tour.
I'm flagship material, Capitano - things like this come with the territory. I know how to look and act professional.
You also know how to whip other people into shape in a hurry...
Is it just me, or is the admiral more than a little late?
He's late. Don't worry, these things never stick to schedule.

Fields.MenuText: It couldn't hurt to swing by the radio room, at least to confirm he's on the way.
He's wasting my time. I'll be in my quarters going over charts - let me know when he shows up.
Hear that, Pola? There's a snack in my wardroom calling my name.

Fields.DialogueText: It probably won't make any difference, Captain. But if it makes you feel better, then no - it can't hurt.
Yes, Captain.
And do you hear that, Captain? It's the sound of my eyes rolling.
*SOME TIME LATER*
Captain! Miss Pola sent me to inform you, the admiral just arrived.
That was faster than I thought. Well, let's not keep him waiting-
Not to worry, Captain. Miss Pola said she'd see him aboard on your behalf to buy you time.
That's not good.
It's not?
Not if he doesn't know her reputation. Did anyone warn him not to call her cute?
Make way! Stretcher coming through!
... Apparently not, Captain.
A sea full of monsters and this is what sinks us.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
*Grumble* *hic* *Grumble*
Sorry about that.
Sorry I knocked you down. Pent-up energy. I blame the bastard who put me in detention. *hic* And pat me on the head.
Well, you did break his arm...in multiple places...
I'd do it again. *Grumble* Cabin Girl... *Grumble*
I'm well aware of that. ...For the record, you aren't in detention. The investigation was pretty open-and-shut, but it still had to be done.
*Grumble* You say that now, Capitano. Wait until we get our *hic* orders.*Grumble*
Where is Reza!? He should be here with my next fiasco by now.

Fields.MenuText: No wonder he looked nervous. Let him off the hook, Pola - I sent him to go deliver a get-well bouquet on your behalf.
Pola, if you're too drunk to get your own bottle of chianti, you've had enough.
You should probably drown your sorrows in something else, Pola. ...Or do you intend to run out of chianti before we even cast off?

Fields.DialogueText: *Grumble* ...If I *hic* must...*Grumble*
Since I haven't had enough yet, I'll *hic* go get it myself. Leave me alone.
We're not going anywhere *hic* soon. But don't worry...I'm using the chianti as a *hic* vodka chaser.
...There's a fight out there.
Cheer up. You'll be back out in the thick of things in no time.
Doesn't change the fact that there's a fight out there now. *hic* *Grumble*...And I'm not in it.*Grumble*
Pola, there's - gah! What just hit me?
I think that blur was Pola, Captain. She's been itching for an excuse to get out of her quarters.
And to knock people down, clearly. She knows she can go incorporeal.
Occupational hazard, Captain.
Officer Reza, have you seen Pola lately? I thought she'd be more lively, since we're getting under way.
She was sparring with a punching bag earlier, but I haven't seen her since then.
...That bag have a name, Officer? I noticed you rubbing your shoulder.
She just had me support the bag from behind, is all. Keep it from flying around all over the place.
That's a yes, then.
By the way, Captain, I wouldn't expect too much of a mood change from her.
How so?
Well, we are just meeting up with a convoy. That's kind of a step down from our usual duties...

Fields.MenuText: There are no small roles, Officer, just small ships. Convoys - and their protection - are vital.
We bust our butts, scouring the seas for the Morganas. Let them come to us for a change.
I know. But we won't be in the doghouse forever.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let Pola hear you say that.
I doubt Pola would feel that way.
I hope not. Letting the Morganas choose the time and place for anything leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
Capitano. ... You! Back to work, Reza! We have to hurry!
R-right away!
What's the rush, Pola?
I found Morganas between us and the convoy staging site. If we hurry, I can sink them and still make it on time!
When you say "between..."
@BATTLE
Between enough. Alle armi!
So. Convoy duty.
Watching things move from one place to another.
That's about the size of it.
I'm bored.

Fields.MenuText: You could always read a book. Or take a nap. Or something, anything...
Don't knock it, Pola. When it comes to convoy duty, I'll take boring.
...And now you've jinxed us. Congratulations, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: Anything, Capitano?
Looks like you got what you wanted, Capitano.
I only wish it were that sim--
*ALARM*
Now that's more like it!
@BATTLE
Grazie Dio! I swear my guns were starting to rust.
Can we find more like them?
Not in these waters, and I'm content to let that be.
...Bored again.
Within reason.
Meh. Afterwards, I'd be back to being bored. So what's the point?
You're looking amused.
Cleaned out Officer Nowak again, did you?
How can you tell?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe it's the insignia on the uniform you're attaching to the tail of that floatplane, Pola.
So the sprint of shame isn't good enough for you anymore?
Maybe with some of the others, Capitano, but Nowak has developed some impressive speed.
Practice makes perfect.
That's probably it. It also means just parading around in his things is getting old too.
There's advertising your win, but actually towing his uniform like a message banner is a bit much.

Fields.MenuText: He should really know better by now, but even Nowak doesn't deserve to be embarrassed like that.
I see that, and I see Fleet HQ saying "Now there's a Belle who needs to be part of field testing uniforms! She'll really put them through their paces!"
If you wanted to prolong his suffering you're going at it the wrong way. You need to think wing-walking, not tail-chasing.

Fields.DialogueText: If I ever develop a reputation for being soft on my crew I will blame you, Capitano.
Ack! And run the risk of becoming Madame Fashion Plate's dress-up doll? Not a chance in Hell!
Of course. How silly of me.
By the by, Pola, I wonder how many observers might mistake a uniform in tow for some sort of flag or signal.
There's a lot of white in most summer dress, too...
...Killjoy.
@BATTLE
Cheer up. I think we've just found something for you to kill too.
*ALARM*
...Pola. Is this another drill?
Si.
Shut it down please.
... Fine.
What are the purpose of surprise drills, Pola?
To keep the crew on their toes and have them practice for the real thing.
And how many does it take before it's not a surprise anymore?
That remains to be seen, doesn't it?
Look, I know you're bored. And I know a surprise drill now and then helps make actions instinctive when the time comes.
But six of them in a row is about five too many.

Fields.MenuText: At the very least, Pola, clue me in that you're up to something before I hit the showers.
The crew is jumpy enough as it is. I don't know what's coming first: a mass mutiny or a shipwide nervous breakdown.
At this rate, no one will take an alarm seriously...including me. Haven't you ever heard of the boy who cried wolf?

Fields.DialogueText: And miss the chance to see how dignified my capitano can be in a bathrobe?
The nervous breakdown, Capitano. I can promise you there will be no mutinies aboard this ship.
Is that the moral of that story? I would have never guessed.
*ALARM*
Pola...
I didn't start that one.
Then it's no drill!
@BATTLE
Capitano! You're here to step into the ring with me, right?

Fields.MenuText: Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha...
Not in this life, Pola. I'm nowhere near your weight class.
I will step into a ring with you on the day my horoscope says I need to have my nose broken, and not a minute sooner.

Fields.DialogueText: How tragic. Your fear has driven you mad.
That doesn't stop anyone else from sparring with me.
I can arrange that.
I'm here on behalf of the crew to throw in the towel.
...You can't be serious.
I am. In case you hadn't noticed, you're putting your sparring partners in the Infirmary faster than they're being discharged.
...First I get shackled to convoy duty and now I can't spar with anyone.
It's just until convoy duty wraps up, I promise. I also know there are other ways to practice besides sparring, Pola.
You mean like shadowboxing. But it's just not the same, Capitano. It lacks the satisfaction I get when my fist connects with something solid.
Then find another exercise to do.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
No one else is your captain.
Come vuoi. But I'm getting sick of waiting for things to happen.
You. Sailor. With me.
@BATTLE
Are you sure about this, Pola?
Do you want the money or not?
Well, yes, but what about the captain?
Yes. What about the captain?
She roped me into it!
He knows nothing!

Fields.MenuText: Well? I can't think of any reason to be nervous while standing outside a packed mess hall.

Fields.DialogueText: You know what, never mind. I'll do it myself.
Wha-
*inhale*
FOOD FIGHT!!
Let's do this!
Oh my, would you look at that. It appears like there's a brawl going on. Looks like it's time for me to be responsible and break it up...
So...I guess I won't get paid, will I?
Act of God, sailor. You'll get your money.
Miss Pola?
I don't miss and neither should you. Before those Morganas engage, I've got a proposition for you...

Fields.MenuText: There's enough sailors in the infirmary. Was the brig feeling empty?
If you're bored I can find you something less disruptive to do than...whatever you had planned.

Fields.DialogueText: Not really how it works, Capitano, but now's not the time for a lesson in Belle physiology.
Courage. I like that in a capitano.
Doubtless. Not to mention less stimulating.
All right! Since it didn't take the last time, let's review! Repeat after me: I am an adult!
I am an adult!
As an adult, I recognize there are better uses of food than as ammunition to pelt other adults with!
As an adult, I recognize there are better uses of food than as ammunition to pelt other adults with!
Therefore, I will not join a food fight no matter who calls for one!
Therefore, I will not join a food fight no matter who calls for one!

Fields.MenuText: I can't hear you!
Good.
...Unless there's cream pies involved. Then it isn't a food fight, it's hilarity.

Fields.DialogueText: Therefore, I will NOT join a food fight no matter WHO calls for one!!
You're all dismissed.
...Except for you, Pola.
...Damn it.
I asked you to find something to do. This wasn't what I had in mind.
Try something a little more constructive. Please.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nothing more constructive than a victory, Capitano.
*BOOM*
Pola! Pola! Have I got great...uh...Pola? What's with the paper target?
You said be constructive, so I'm making a get-well card for the admiral.
A rather big one. That you're filling full of holes.
Dots, Capitano, dots. I'll add numbers later so he can connect them to form a picture.
I don't think numbers will be necessary - with the grouping you've got going there, I think the image is pretty obvious...
You were looking for me?
...Right. I've got good news and great news.
The good news is that our latest mission still involves a delivery run, but I'm told it's an important job.
So, what do you consider the great news?
We're the only ones involved in it, so all that's holding us back is the limit of your turbines.
And not the slowest cow in the convoy, hm? That is good news. Then it's back to business as usual!

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely!
I wouldn't go quite that far, Pola, but he can't stay sore at us forever.
It had better be. If he won't let bygones be bygones after this...

Fields.DialogueText: I'll drink to that.
That's his prerogative.
If he won't forgive and forget, he'd better have his will in order.
I haven't told the crew yet, so feel free to pass the word for me. I'll take care of your ''card'' for you.
Yes, Capitano!
*Sigh.*
Somebody dodged a bullet this time. ...Probably me.
Brace to do it again, Capitano. I spy with my little eye a pack of Cariddi...
@BATTLE
Capitano, I'd like you to explain something to me.
Uh, sure...if I can...
What is it about calliope music that turns adult humans into idiots? Just a hint of it on the air, and the crew were all over themselves to start shore leave...
You've never heard of circuses before this, Pola?
Sure, I've heard of them. They tell me the Circo Nazionale Togni is even praiseworthy. But so what? What's the appeal?
It's cheap entertainment with a hint of the exotic. They come in, larger than life, and move on before their acts get old.
Not everyone gets to travel quite as much as we do and everyone likes a little escapism, now and then.
Huh.
I'm sure there'd be something in a circus to tickle even your fancy...

Fields.MenuText: Like the daring young man on the flying trapeze. They're even more impressive without a net, too.
I personally get the biggest kick out of clowns. Watching a bunch of them pratfall and bounce off each other always brings a smile to my face.
You can think of an animal - any animal - and I'll bet that some circus somewhere has an act involving it. Horses, elephants, lions and tigers...

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, did you see the last time we had to retrieve my planes during stormy seas? It would take a lot from a scripted, sheltered wire act to impress me.
Please, Capitano... the clowns in the INPF leadership ranks are more than enough for me.
Bears, camels, etcetera, etcetera. Cap, any modern animal act has to compete with venationes, and man-versus-beast combat kind of makes everything else pale in comparison. ...Still...
But there is something respectable about wild animals, I'll admit.
The concept of bending some lion or tiger's will sounds like something worth taking a second glance at, I suppose.
I'm glad you feel that way. That makes me feel better about our next mission.
Remember that it's a pick-up-and-delivery run, right? We're picking up a handler first, then...
Capitano, permission to be blunt.
This has got to be the biggest waste of time and materiel I've ever heard. I'm not crazy about convoys these days, but Capitano...
The INPF doesn't exist in a vacuum, Pola. Circuses and fairs keep people happy, so there are a lot of officials insisting the show must go on.
And if that show requires a few new lions, tigers, and bears, then there are folks in high places willing and able to poke the INPF into doing the legwork.
Wonderful. Yet another mission that keeps me out of the fight.
When did you ever hear me say that? We'll be on our own schedule for this one.
And if we just happen to run into Morganas...
Parli del diavolo...To the bridge, Capitano!
Gingerly granted.
@BATTLE
That's them?
Looks like. Remember, Pola: these are civilians. Cut them a little slack, okay?
I'll think about it. They all look strapping enough, despite being senza uniformi. I think we'll get along.
Once they're stowed, we go?
That's the plan.
Then I'll go up to the bridge and signal my warning of departure.
I think you mean intention.
I meant exactly what I said, Capitano.
Of course she did.
Captain! I know you're busy, but I just wanted to thank you personally for this.

Fields.MenuText: Thanks aren't needed. The extra fodder for sailor yarns that I and my crew are going to get is more than enough.
You should probably hold off on thanking me until after this mission is complete.
The best way you can thank me is for you and your people to stay where you're told and do what you're told with no questions.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, trust me, that gift goes both ways!
I'm still grateful, Captain, that you're willing to go through with it in the first place.
Understood, Captain. A secure place for us and the menagerie is all I ask for.
Captain... Looking this way...is that...?
Pola? Yeah. Before she comes over, let me warn you-
She's not tame.
I'm not sure if I'd go that far...most of the time, anyway...
I'll put it to you this way. Were it not for these chickenpox scars, I would be the one in the cage in front of the crowds, instead of acting as assistant on the outside...
I know a lioness looking for an opportunity when I see one!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
There it is. Return to your quarters.
Do you have a minute?
Certainly!
I'm curious. You kind of pegged Pola as soon as you met her.
The officer who examined our papers did give us fair warning...
That's just it. Pola is already infamous, but that doesn't stop people who should know better from taking her at face value.
Yes, she is rather-

Fields.MenuText: Bad at taking a compliment.
Short. ...Uh, tempered....short-tempered. Yeah.
Good at hearing perceived slurs, so the next word you were going to say was feisty...right?

Fields.DialogueText: I was going to say "sensitive," but I suppose as her captain, you can be a little less diplomatic...
... And they say lion tamers are foolhardy...
Right... let's go with that.
Any insight from a circus perspective? What can I do to help her make a more intimidating first impression, aside from putting bars between her and newcomers?
Only at first impression?
She's very good at taking it from there.
Ah. I think anyone who doesn't take the hint after looking her in the eye is a lost cause.
I think so too. Hmmm... Maybe if she was right at the rail and made eye contact as people come up the gangplank...
Wait. The first thing they'd make eye contact with is her hemline, so scratch that...
*ALARM*
Successful defense of my title as best smoke-ring blower of them all, and Morganas in my sights.
Throw in a victory wine binge afterwards, and life doesn't get any better. Relax, Capitano.
I'm not worried about the Morganas. I was just in the middle of brainstorming a way you could look people in the eye better.
Is that all? I can always float above the deck couple of feet, and-
Go from underestimated to otherworldly? No thanks, Pola, you're good right where you are now.
@BATTLE
I could have told you that.
I see you're making gift baskets.
Si. I thought I'd send my sisters a few of the more exotic treats I've been able to pick up on this trip.
That's certainly thoughtful of you, but I thought you only had three sisters.
That's right.
Then who's the fourth basket for?
That's for me.
That would explain why it's as big as the other three combined.

Fields.MenuText: It's the thought that counts.
Before you close them up, give me a chance to add a few things too.
You know, Pola, it wouldn't kill you to be a little more generous.

Fields.DialogueText: How right you are, Capitano!
If you insist, Capitano.
Exactly how much more?
By the way, Pola, could I ask you to hold off cleaning out anyone else for the rest of the mission?
Even Officer Nowak deserves more of a break between losing streaks.
What are you talking about?
I mean since our last battle. He...I thought you... You mean that wasn't your doing?
No, Capitano. ... But unless he's taken up being an exibitionist, I intend to find out who did.
@BATTLE
That's not for me to decide.
Fine, fine. I can always send Reza out to get more for me later.
I do. They probably deserve medals for putting up with you, so I'd like to do at least this much.
*ALARM*
Dannazione a tutto. If these aren't intact once the battle is over, I'm going to be in an uncommonly foul mood.
Grr..I'd just finished sewing those gloves!
@BATTLE
Officer Reza! My quarters! My laundry list isn't getting any shorter!
B-but, the battle... I still have work-
My. Quarters. NOW!
...Yes, Pola.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, no you don't, Pola. The officer has his work to do first - then you can monopolize his down time all you want.
Sorry, Reza. Better you than me.
Pola, give the man a break and do your own laundry!

Fields.DialogueText: I'll finish his work here, then. I refuse to let him use the eve of destruction as an excuse to put my tasks for him on the back burner.
My hero. If you don't want me to give you work, Capitano, then get out of my way.
Sure, I'll give him a break...I'll break his legs so he has nothing but down time to do my laundry!
(Some Time Later)
Where's Officer Reza? I wanted to make sure you weren't abusing the poor guy.
I sent him to the infirmary.
Pola-!
He was late to his station in that last battle.
He was putting up a good front and his uniform covered it up, but I could tell he was in no shape to finish his duties afterwards.
...And?
And his cranky Belle bawled him out for being slow to his post, then knocked him around so much he needed to go to the Infirmary.
You mean covered for him, grilled him for the details in private and sent him to get medical attention. You've even taken the blame for his injuries.
I don't know what you're talking about, Cap. I'd never do anything like that. It would ruin my reputation.
Have it your way then. But if you take the blame, won't Officer Reza's actual attacker will go unpunished?
Don't worry about that, Capitano. He will get his due.
You! Yes, you! Officer Witherspoon should be done by now. Tell him to get over here and finish Officer Reza's sorry job.
Pola.
Fine.
Maybe you shouldn't have thrown that Morgana's dud back at her.
Vabbè. I have people for this.
... Hmm.
Is something wrong?
Not wrong, just confusing. Miss Pola was just here, asking some odd questions.

Fields.MenuText: I can sympathize. I still have trouble wrapping my mind around how she thinks, and I'm her captain.
Define odd. Were they ''odd'' because they were personal or had answers you didn't know?
I apologize. If she was demanding answers or pestering you, I'll ask her to cease and desist.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it takes two human heads to come up with what goes on in one Belle's head, eh?
Neither of those, Captain. I guess they were odd because I wasn't expecting them.
Don't worry, she was no trouble at all. She just asked a few questions, then left.
I suppose I found them odd because I figured if she ever asked me anything, it would be related to my work, the menagerie, or the circus.
I thought if she ever came to see you, it would be to ask if she could wrestle the roughest beast you've got.
...Or try to beg, buy, or ''borrow'' it...
I wouldn't consider those inquiries odd though, Captain, since I hear them all the time.
She was more interested in the extra hands I brought with me. One in particular...
Captain, if Mister Smith has caused you and your crew trouble, I'm truly sorry. He wouldn't be here If he hadn't been foisted on me, you see.
No one has complained about him that I know of.
People rarely do. But he doubles as a strongman and he's capable of being quite...persuasive.
It sounds like you wouldn't shed too many tears if he went overboard.
I trust you aren't suggesting anything-!
I'm not. But I do need to know.
I may become his last, best hope for reaching land safely, if that's the case.
*ALARM*
A little proof of concept, Captain?
For the Morganas, though day to day they'd be the least of his worries...
@BATTLE
Do it! Do it! Do it! Do it!
What's going on?
Pola just challenged that Smith guy to a boxing match!
Well? I haven't stepped in the ring with either you or your boss yet, and since he is your boss, he goes last.

Fields.MenuText: Pola, don't be so pushy.
Back to work, all of you! This negotiation for a FRIENDLY match is between Pola and Mr. Smith.
Do it! Do it! Do it!

Fields.DialogueText: There's no harm in just asking, is there?
Cap is right, this is for a friendly. And if you people jeopardize my chance for that...
Does this mean I'll get you to step into the ring afterwards, Capitano?
I'm flattered, but I wouldn't want to distract you from your duties.
Boooooo!
I haven't been distracted from a fight with the Morganas by anyone yet.
But if you're that worried, I'm willing to wait until we reach our last port. Acceptable?
I accept.
I look forward to it!
That was very mature of you, Pola. Well done.
...He's going to jump ship as soon as we get there.
You're still grinning though. ...More than ever, if that's even possible...
I just fired a warning shot over his bow, and he thinks he's slippery enough to get away.
Heh, heh. This is getting interesting now!... Drat.
Morganas?
Morganas. He's going to be saying he told me so for the whole damned tour...
@BATTLE
Don't let this get to your head, Nowak!
Pola, what happened? Officer Nowak... is still dressed!
Let's just say that Nowak is still learning to recognize the many ways he can be taken advantage of at poker.
So I made sure to get myself invited to the table this time.
In other words, it took a cheat to counter a cheat.

Fields.MenuText: I'd have to have my head examined before I ever play with you...
Wouldn't it have been easier to just teach him the signs? You know, teaching a man to fish instead of giving him one?
Because no one else gets to swindle and humiliate Officer Nowak but you. Do you know how arrogant that is?

Fields.DialogueText: Suit yourself, but you don't know what you're missing, Cap.
Which do you think is taken to heart better: discovering for yourself what a trick is or having someone else explain it to you?
Yet Nowak still keeps coming back to the table to play me.
I take it from your lack of of extra clothing that Mister Smith managed to escape with more than his dignity.
Oh, his wallet was thinner when he left the table than when he sat down. But he was smart enough to get out before I could get him.
And that's fine too. It means I have time to grab a bottle and get a few hands in with the guys he came on board with.
I can't wait to hear what gems they can tell.
You don't have to believe me, but he's proud to to be a measuring gauge for this crew. They know if you can't beat him, you have absolutely no business playing me.
...But we're entering Morgana territory. This irks me. I'm violent when irked.
@BATTLE
That's the spirit.
Good grief, Pola! You look like hell!
You should see the other guy.
Sounds like I've got to prepare for a burial at sea, then.
Don't be so melodramatic, Capitano. He'll be taking his meals through a straw for a while, but he's not dead.

Fields.MenuText: Do I have time to get drunk before I start filling out the Incident Report, or do I have to wait until afterwards?
...A lawyer. I KNEW there was something I forgot to pick up when we were last in port...
If I may, I'd like to get a second opinion on your prognosis, Doctor Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to get drunk, don't hold back on my account.
Never pummeled one of those before.
Be my guest, but I've hit enough people by now to have a good idea of the damage I've done.
Well? Let me hear your side of the story.
My leeches finally arrived-
Stop. ...Leeches?
My backup plan to deal with bruises from the fight club, before you found out about it. Surprisingly effective, and it's fun to watch people squirm.
I'm sure I don't need to ask which appealed to you more.
I figured the infirmary could still use them, so I was taking some there. One thing led to another, and a certain would-be strongman ended up wearing one.
Heh. Frankly, I'm surprised you couldn't hear him shrieking "Get it off me!" from here.
And he just happened to end up with a leech on his face, so you naturally obliged with your fist.
What? What do you take me for, Cap! It was just a teeny, tiny one on his hand.
Oh. Sorry, go ahead and continue.
Then he went as hysterical and panicked as a drowning man, so I knocked him out cold first.
Then I removed it.
How was I supposed to know he'd had a bad experience with them on safari before? I had absolutely no idea...
You'll find most humans don't have good experiences with leeches.
But you can't deny they're useful. Rather like us Belles.
@BATTLE
I think you're missing the point.
*ALARM*
Can't hear you, Capitano. I'm off to be useful.
Pola, about this enlistment application I found on my desk...
An enlistment application, eh? Sounds like we impressed one of the circus spares.
Impressed may be right...this is your handwriting.
Er...why, so it is...
Really, Pola...his name is "Cassius Rex?"
It certainly isn't John Smith.
Hear me out, Capitano. It wasn't my idea at first, but... Reza can attest to his strength. And he isn't stupid, I've learned that much. He's just undisciplined.
The idea of letting that much raw potential slip off my decks... wasted, bleeding in some back alley or ditch somewhere... it galls me.

Fields.MenuText: Pola, we're talking about a commitment to join a navy here. You just can't fill paperwork like this and expect me to accept it.
You did have a certain amount of insight when it came to this crew and their need for stress relief...
How much of that raw potential includes the fact that you haven't had your chance in the ring with him yet?

Fields.DialogueText: His hand is still banged up, so I filled it out for him. He signed it himself...I promise you that no one held a gun to his head.
I've seen bigger losers than him find their place in the Regia Marina and become exemplary sailors.
I traded blows with him and walked away. He didn't.
*ALARM*
I'll make my decision later. Right now, we have work to do.
@BATTLE
The one who's eager to enter the ring and prove what he's actually capable of is him, Cap. I'm still looking forward to it, of course.
Well Pola, it looks like you'll get your way. I interviewed Mister...uh, Rex, who expressed his honest desire to enlist.
I'm told members of the crew have already loaned him some handbooks to get him started while he's recuperating.
I went into this mission half-expecting you to adopt something. I thought it would be a lion or a leopard, not a roustabout.
Why would I do that?
Why-? Knowing you, I thought you'd find wild predators interesting.
I do. But to keep one as a pet or mascot? I have enough trouble being taken seriously.
How do you figure that?
Simple, Capitano. It's no secret that small things are thought of as...as...
...Adorabile... Pah!
Would the she-wolf have cared for Romulus and Remus if they were fully grown? Of course not!
Now, if I had a bear or tiger at my side it would dwarf me. I'd become a cub by default, see?
I guess I can see the logic. But not everything in the world is bigger than you.
I suppose you mean like foxes or wildcats? They're even worse, since they accentuate my own stature.

Fields.MenuText: You're over-thinking things, Pola. if you don't believe me, find anyone who would willingly cuddle a Tasmanian devil.
I'll keep your feelings in mind if anything tries to follow me back from shore leave.
Oh, good. I was worried you might someday get it in your head to tease Bulldog or Nerpa...

Fields.DialogueText: Is that a challenge?
I'd appreciate that.
Now that you mention it, maybe a fish tank would be rather amusing...
*ALARM*
...Hmmm...
Don't go there, Pola.
Heh.
@BATTLE
No. I deserved that, and the answer is still no.
Not much longer now. I'm sure you've had more than your fill of odd jobs for a while.
Maybe fate will smile on me, and this will be my good deed for the war.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I'm sure fate gets a hearty laugh at your expense all the time.
I'll drink to that.
Of course it will. It smiled on you enough to make me your captain, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I see that I've been rubbing off on you, Capitano.
Good idea. I'll be right back...
I want to thank you again for your help, Captain. I'm sorry I couldn't give you more aid with your first impressions puzzle.
You did your best.
I also have a gift for you, Pola.
It's not a live present, I hope...
Pola, be polite.
No. I thought that, as someone who also faces dangerous creatures for a living, I'd leave you a set of my tools of the trade. For good luck.
So that explains why you're carrying that chair--
Oh no. No, no, no...
The absolute last thing in the world Pola needs is a--
BULLWHIP!!
Muahahahahahaha!
Well, it's been nice knowing you. You'd better leave the chair and flee, while you still can.
Hmm... Captain... I just thought of something that may solve your first impressions problem.
You think the bullwhip doesn't?!
You know, one of these days your eyes are going to roll right out of your head.
And I expect you to react quickly when they do, so they don't roll overboard.
I sense Morganas lurking nearby, Capitano! Let me at them! This weapon can sting at the speed of sound!
@BATTLE
While I'll admit the miniature battle flag across the the back is a nice touch, how this chair will be essential for future reviews is escaping me.
Hear me out, Pola. As soon as he mentioned it, I saw exactly what he was talking about.
Back from where I come from, there are people who also have a... deficiency in stature... who still hold the attention of thousands, if not tens of thousands of people at a time.
And the one thing they've got that you haven't got?
A soapbox. Or a pulpit, or podium.
So with the proper adornment a simple chair becomes a podium. I guess it is less natural to reach up to pet someone...
Exactly. You also get to look down on people, without looking like you're trying to look down on them.
It's not foolproof, I'll admit. Though, I don't think you'll ever have an issue with the blind... you give off enough other cues to pick up.
What of idiots who can't take the hint, even after all that?
Grab the chair back as you hop off and shove the legs in their face.

Fields.MenuText: Cracking the bullwhip is fine too... so long as you don't hit anyone with it.
...But no bullwhip, okay?
Feel free to be as humiliating as possible, Pola. You beat an idiot once, it's shame on you. If you must beat an idiot twice, shame on them.

Fields.DialogueText: That won't be a problem, Cap. I've been practicing!
...All right. I still want to wear it, though.
Oh I will, Capitano! I will!
One last thing, Pola. The podium is yours as soon as a review starts, but from now on, the chair will also provide a resting place prior to any review.
For me, that is. And I saw that eye roll!
Not my intent, Capitano. I think I see some Morganas on the horizon.
Not your intent?
Not my primary intent. Not anymore. Take pride in that, Capitano. I certainly do.
